course.title: CSI 5183 Evolutionary Computation and Artificial Life (3 units)
course.desc: Study of algorithms based upon biological theories of evolution, applications to machine learning and optimization problems. Possible topics: Genetic Algorithms, Classifier Systems, and Genetic Programming. Recent work in the fields of Artificial Life (swarm intelligence, distributed agents, behavior-based AI) and of connectionism. This course is equivalent to COMP 5206 at Carleton University.Course Component: LecturePrecludes additional credit for COMP 4107.
